rgl2gltf 0.1.3
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Shininess in OpenGL 1 versus glTF PBR

Print gltf objects.

print.gltf.Rd

Prints "gltf" objects with various levels of detail.

# S3 method for gltf
print(x, verbose = FALSE, names = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

x

The object to print.

verbose

A character vector naming the sections that should be printed in full detail, or a logical value, with TRUE indicating all sections should be printed verbosely.

names

A character vector naming the sections for which object names should be printed, if present.

...

Currently ignored.

Details

The recognized section names for verbose are: "accessors", "asset", "scene", "scenes", "nodes", "buffers", "bufferViews", "meshes", "cameras", "materials", "textures" and "images". Unique prefixes will be recognized.

Value

The x object is printed and then returned invisibly.

Examples

samples <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/KhronosGroup/glTF-Sample-Models/master/2.0"

gltf <- readGLB(paste0(samples, "/2CylinderEngine/glTF-Binary/2CylinderEngine.glb?raw=true"))

print(gltf, names = "meshes")
